question.title: Using the data of the children to order with eBean fails
question.body:
I have two ebean object in Playframework 3.0.5 and ebean 3.0.0. MessageThread, which has MessageItems:

In MessageThread:

@OrderBy("addDate ASC")
@OneToMany(mappedBy = "thread", cascade = {CascadeType.REMOVE})
private List<MessageItem> messages;

I want to get all the messages for a user, ordered by what is the latest message in the thread.

I tried it manually and with the use of aggregation:

@Aggregation("max(messages.addDate)")     // aggregation property Date
lastMessage;

and

query.orderBy("lastMessage desc").findList();

or:

query.orderBy("max(messages.addDate) desc").findList();

The result in both cases is the same, I get the error:

jakarta.persistence.PersistenceException: Query threw SQLException:Column "T0.ID" must be in the GROUP BY list; SQL statement:
    select distinct t0.id, t0.deleted, t0.message_ref, t0.sticky, t0.last_update, t0.add_date, t0.role_id, t0.syndicate_id, max(u1.add_date) from message_thread t0 left join message_item u1 on u1.thread_id = t0.id left join message_status u2 on u2.message_id = u1.id left join device u3 on u3.id = u2.device_id left join syndicate t2 on t2.id = t0.syndicate_id left join message_item t1 on t1.thread_id = t0.id where ((t0.role_id in (?,?,?,?,?) and t2.region_id = ?) or (u1.sender_id = ? or u3.user_id = ?)) order by max(u1.add_date) desc limit 10 [90016-224] Bind values:[] Query was:select distinct t0.id, t0.deleted, t0.message_ref, t0.sticky, t0.last_update, t0.add_date, t0.role_id, t0.syndicate_id, max(u1.add_date) from message_thread t0 left join message_item u1 on u1.thread_id = t0.id left join message_status u2 on u2.message_id = u1.id left join device u3 on u3.id = u2.device_id left join syndicate t2 on t2.id = t0.syndicate_id left join message_item t1 on t1.thread_id = t0.id where ((t0.role_id in (?,?,?,?,?) and t2.region_id = ?) or (u1.sender_id = ? or u3.user_id = ?)) order by max(u1.add_date) desc limit 10

I have been reading the documentation and the group by clause is supposed to be generated as far as I can see. I cannot find a way either to manually add it.

Any help will be much appreciated.
